text: A quick HubL question. With this: {{ content.blog_post_author.twitter }} I get the url of the blog post author’s twitter account. Is there a way to print just their Twitter username. IE: The above prints: <https://twitter.com/RayleeMelton> but I want to display @RayleeMelton on the actual page.
can also use {{ content.blog_post_author.twitter_username }} which would be the most optimal
Awesome <@U2H3TT8F2>! Thanks so much for that. I figured there was a HubL code for it (your 2nd example), but a good example of something that I didn’t see documented anywhere :slightly_smiling_face:
